verses.verse: Ye <WH859> are the children<WH1121> of the LORD<WH3068> your God:<WH430> ye shall not<WH3808> cut yourselves,<WH1413> nor<WH3808> make<WH7760> any baldness<WH7144> between<WH996> your eyes<WH5869> for the dead.<WH4191>

For <WH3588> thou<WH859> art a holy<WH6918> people<WH5971> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God,<WH430> and the LORD<WH3068> hath chosen<WH977> thee to be<WH1961> a peculiar<WH5459> people<WH5971> unto himself, above all<WH4480> <WH3605> the nations<WH5971> that<WH834> are upon<WH5921> <WH6440> the earth.<WH127>
Thou shalt not<WH3808> eat<WH398> any<WH3605> abominable thing.<WH8441>
These <WH2063> are the beasts<WH929> which<WH834> ye shall eat:<WH398> the ox,<WH7794> the sheep,<WH7716> <WH3775> and the goat,<WH7716> <WH5795>
The hart,<WH354> and the roebuck,<WH6643> and the fallow deer,<WH3180> and the wild goat,<WH689> and the pygarg,<WH1788> and the wild ox,<WH8377> and the chamois.<WH2169>

And every<WH3605> beast<WH929> that parteth<WH6536> the hoof,<WH6541> and cleaveth<WH8156> the cleft<WH8157> into two<WH8147> claws,<WH6541> and cheweth<WH5927> the cud<WH1625> among the beasts,<WH929> that ye shall eat.<WH398>

Nevertheless <WH389> <WH853> these<WH2088> ye shall not<WH3808> eat<WH398> of them that chew<WH4480> <WH5927> the cud,<WH1625> or of them that divide<WH4480> <WH6536> the cloven<WH8156> hoof;<WH6541> as<WH853> the camel,<WH1581> and the hare,<WH768> and the coney:<WH8227> for<WH3588> they<WH1992> chew<WH5927> the cud,<WH1625> but divide<WH6536> not<WH3808> the hoof;<WH6541> therefore they<WH1992> are unclean<WH2931> unto you.

And the swine,<WH2386> because<WH3588> it<WH1931> divideth<WH6536> the hoof,<WH6541> yet cheweth not<WH3808> the cud,<WH1625> it<WH1931> is unclean<WH2931> unto you: ye shall not<WH3808> eat<WH398> of their flesh,<WH4480> <WH1320> nor<WH3808> touch<WH5060> their dead carcass.<WH5038>
<WH853> These<WH2088> ye shall eat<WH398> of all<WH4480> <WH3605> that<WH834> are in the waters:<WH4325> all<WH3605> that<WH834> have fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> shall ye eat: <WH398>
And whatsoever<WH3605> <WH834> hath not<WH369> fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> ye may not<WH3808> eat;<WH398> it<WH1931> is unclean<WH2931> unto you.
Of all<WH3605> clean<WH2889> birds<WH6833> ye shall eat.<WH398>
But these<WH2088> are they of which<WH834> ye shall not<WH3808> eat:<WH398> the eagle,<WH5404> and the ossifrage,<WH6538> and the osprey,<WH5822>
And the glede,<WH7201> and the kite,<WH344> and the vulture<WH1772> after his kind,<WH4327>
And every<WH3605> raven<WH6158> after his kind,<WH4327>
And the owl,<WH1323> <WH3284> and the night hawk,<WH8464> and the cuckoo,<WH7828> and the hawk<WH5322> after his kind,<WH4327>
<WH853> The little owl,<WH3563> and the great owl,<WH3244> and the swan,<WH8580>
And the pelican,<WH6893> and the gier-eagle,<WH7360> and the cormorant,<WH7994>
And the stork,<WH2624> and the heron<WH601> after her kind,<WH4327> and the lapwing,<WH1744> and the bat.<WH5847>
And every<WH3605> creeping thing<WH8318> that flieth<WH5775> is unclean<WH2931> unto you: they shall not<WH3808> be eaten.<WH398>
But of all<WH3605> clean<WH2889> fowls<WH5775> ye may eat.<WH398>

Ye shall not<WH3808> eat<WH398> of any<WH3605> thing that dieth of itself:<WH5038> thou shalt give<WH5414> it unto the stranger<WH1616> that<WH834> is in thy gates,<WH8179> that he may eat<WH398> it; or<WH176> thou mayest sell<WH4376> it unto an alien:<WH5237> for<WH3588> thou<WH859> art a holy<WH6918> people<WH5971> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God.<WH430> Thou shalt not<WH3808> seethe<WH1310> a kid<WH1423> in his mother's<WH517> milk.<WH2461>
Thou shalt truly tithe<WH6237> <WH6237> <WH853> all<WH3605> the increase<WH8393> of thy seed,<WH2233> that the field<WH7704> bringeth forth<WH3318> year<WH8141> by year.<WH8141>

And thou shalt eat<WH398> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> thy God,<WH430> in the place<WH4725> which<WH834> he shall choose<WH977> to place<WH7931> his name<WH8034> there,<WH8033> the tithe<WH4643> of thy corn,<WH1715> of thy wine,<WH8492> and of thine oil,<WH3323> and the firstlings<WH1062> of thy herds<WH1241> and of thy flocks;<WH6629> that<WH4616> thou mayest learn<WH3925> to fear<WH3372> <WH853> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> always.<WH3605> <WH3117>

And if<WH3588> the way<WH1870> be too long<WH7235> for<WH4480> thee, so that<WH3588> thou art not able<WH3201> <WH3808> to carry<WH5375> it; or if<WH3588> the place<WH4725> be too far<WH7368> from<WH4480> thee, which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> shall choose<WH977> to set<WH7760> his name<WH8034> there,<WH8033> when<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath blessed<WH1288> thee:

Then shalt thou turn<WH5414> it into money,<WH3701> and bind up<WH6696> the money<WH3701> in thine hand,<WH3027> and shalt go<WH1980> unto<WH413> the place<WH4725> which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> shall choose: <WH977>

And thou shalt bestow<WH5414> that money<WH3701> for whatsoever<WH3605> <WH834> thy soul<WH5315> lusteth after,<WH183> for oxen,<WH1241> or for sheep,<WH6629> or for wine,<WH3196> or for strong drink,<WH7941> or for whatsoever<WH3605> <WH834> thy soul<WH5315> desireth:<WH7592> and thou shalt eat<WH398> there<WH8033> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> thy God,<WH430> and thou shalt rejoice,<WH8055> thou,<WH859> and thine household,<WH1004>
And the Levite<WH3881> that<WH834> is within thy gates;<WH8179> thou shalt not<WH3808> forsake<WH5800> him; for<WH3588> he hath no<WH369> part<WH2506> nor inheritance<WH5159> with<WH5973> thee.

At the end<WH4480> <WH7097> of three<WH7969> years<WH8141> thou shalt bring forth<WH3318> <WH853> all<WH3605> the tithe<WH4643> of thine increase<WH8393> the same<WH1931> year,<WH8141> and shalt lay it up<WH5117> within thy gates: <WH8179>

And the Levite,<WH3881> (because<WH3588> he hath no<WH369> part<WH2506> nor inheritance<WH5159> with<WH5973> thee,) and the stranger,<WH1616> and the fatherless,<WH3490> and the widow,<WH490> which<WH834> are within thy gates,<WH8179> shall come,<WH935> and shall eat<WH398> and be satisfied;<WH7646> that<WH4616> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> thee in all<WH3605> the work<WH4639> of thine hand<WH3027> which<WH834> thou doest.<WH6213>
